medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic schizoaffective disorder with periods of agitation and psychosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A, a 62-year-old woman, was hospitalized continuously since age 23 after ingesting iodine. Initial symptoms included auditory hallucinations and bizarre behavior. Over time, her symptoms fluctuated, marked by periods of excitement occurring almost monthly, with notable physical and behavioral changes. She experienced two excited periods per year in the first five years, escalating to a notable behavioral cycle of about 50 days, characterized by sleeplessness, weight loss, incoherent speech, irritability, and assaultive behavior.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ms. A has a history of continuous hospitalization for 40 years due to schizoaffective disorder, catatonic type. She underwent bilateral oophorectomy and hysterectomy for leiomyomata in 1969, which had no documented effect on her psychiatric illness.
medical_history.family_history: Ms. A was one of a twin pair; her twin died before age 1. Her older sister, who was outgoing and successful, died of typhoid fever two years before Ms. A's admission, contributing to her emotional distress.
